text: Juan Berthy ("Chicho") Suárez (born June 24, 1969 in Santa Cruz de la Sierra) is a retired Bolivian football striker. His former clubs are Blooming, Guabirá, MLS team D.C. United, The Strongest and Oriente Petrolero. He finished his career with a second spell in The Strongest. He also played for the Bolivia national team between 1991 and 1999, scoring 8 goals in 28 games.Bolivia - Record International Players - RSSSF ==Honours== {| class="wikitable" !Season !Club !Title |- |1995|| Guabirá|| Liga de Fútbol Profesional Boliviano top scorer: 29 goals |- |} ==References== * *RSSSF Topscorers Category:1969 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Santa Cruz de la Sierra Category:Bolivian footballers Category:Bolivia international footballers Category:Bolivian expatriate footballers Category:1991 Copa América players Category:1995 Copa América players Category:Bolivian Primera División players Category:Club Blooming players Category:D.C.
